responses:
If you are planning to buy some groceries for yourself, there are several mall that you can visit that have grocery store:

1. Jaya One Aeon Big
https://maps.app.goo.gl/AZ9q1Y1ZpttneErv9 

 2. The Sphere Aeon
https://maps.app.goo.gl/kbcoSLFfC8JBV8ug7 

 3. KL Gateway Village Grocer
https://maps.app.goo.gl/GU6EYddzJ9cpcy5S9

Additionally, there is a night market every every Tuesday where you can find fresh local produce and local goods. The night market held behind the UM International House. Below are the location of the night market:
https://maps.app.goo.gl/C2Jkzj9DtwDMDNhY7

Lastly, if you are looking for basic items such as eggs, instant noodles, snacks, etc, you may go to KK Mart, which is located at Kompleks Perdanasiswa (KPS) and also Kolej Kediaman 12 (KK12) in University Malaya.

responses:
The ISC Office will be located at the first floor of Block G, Kompleks Perdanasiswa (KPS). Here is the link of Google Map to ISC Office: 

https://maps.app.goo.gl/Ck4LiLq9nMkU8h8k7 

To reach the ISC Office, you can take any bus within UM to get to UM Sentral. From there, it’s just a short walk to Kompleks Perdanasiswa (KPS).

Are there any holds or blocks on my account preventing course module registration?
Is there a specific process I need to follow to register for the course module?
Has the registration period for the course module ended?
Can you provide guidance on troubleshooting issues with course module registration?
responses:
If you are facing the registration course problems, there may be several factors that causes it to happens:

- Not connected to the internet.
- You are not entering the right username or password 
- MAYA portal is currently crashed as too many request from too many users.
- You are trying to register courses where the Occurence is not 1M.

If any of the following problems ensure, please ensure that you are connected to the internet, entering the right username and password, and only register 1M Occurence courses. If the MAYA portal is too slow or crashed during your registration, make sure to stay updated with the Telegram group announcement and give it some time for the Portal to be fixed.

If you still have problems that is not answered by this respond, feel free to ask the buddies or email the ISC officer.

How can I ensure that the course I register for aligns with my academic or career goals?
Are there any prerequisites or recommendations for the course I'm considering registering for?
Who can provide advice or guidance on selecting the right course to register for?
responses:
Mobility students can only register for courses that have an occurrence of 1M. You may choose any of the courses, even those from different faculties.

If you want to take courses that do not have an occurrence of 1M, you need to ask the officers in the ISC Office and get approval from the lecturer.

Any transfer credit-related matters will depend on the mobility student and their home university.

patterns: What should I do if I don't have enough credits?

Are there any exceptions or waivers available for students with not enough credits?
What impact does not having enough credits have on my academic progress?
Are there specific courses or activities I can undertake to earn additional credits?
How can I determine the number of credits I need to fulfill my requirements?
Is there a minimum credit requirement for maintaining enrollment status?
Are there any restrictions or limitations for students with insufficient credits?
What strategies can I use to ensure I have enough credits for graduation?
Who can I consult for assistance with planning my credit requirements?
responses:
Exchange students do not have a specific number of credits they need to take unless it is explicitly stated by their home university. If you do not meet the required amount of credits as specified by your university, you will need to meet with the ISC officer to resolve the issue. 

Please make sure to bring any supporting documents that indicate you must take a certain number of credits.

responses:
There are some popular places inside and outside of University Malaya that students love to go for meals.

Inside University Malaya:
1. Kolej Kediaman 7 (KK7)
2. Food Avenue, Kolej Kediaman 12 (KK12)
3. Chicken Rice from Faculty of Arts and Social Science, University Malaya

Outside University Malaya:
There are some franchise restaurants at any of the nearest malls. However, here are some of the University Malaya's students' favorite spots:
1. Nasi Lemak Anjing (Restaurant Al-Ehsan)
2. Nasi Lemak Bumbung
3. Pokok KL
4. Piccadilly Restaurant (Having 1001 menu items)
5. Many More!!!!

Feel free to ask anyone or even buddies for more suggestions!!!

responses:
You can explore Kuala Lumpur (KL) and the University of Malaya (UM) using the convenient public transport options available nearby. The LRT and MRT buses can take you to their respective train stations. For easy navigation and route planning, we recommend downloading the Moovit app. Alternatively, you can use Grab to reach your desired destinations.

From University Malaya, you can access the LRT bus T789 at the following locations:
- Law Faculty
- Kolej Kediaman 1 (KK1)
- Faculty of Engineering
- UM Sentral
- Dewan Tunku Canselor UM
- Center of Foundation Studies of University of Malaya

Similarly, the MRT bus T815 can be accessed from these points within University Malaya:
- Faculty of Business and Economics
- UM Sentral
- Center of Foundation Studies of University of Malaya
- Kolej Kediaman 12 (KK12)
- Kolej Kediaman 5 (KK5)
- Kolej Kediaman 11 (KK11)
- Kolej Kediaman 8 (KK8)
- Faculty of Computer Science and Information Technology
- Faculty of Malay Studies
- Kolej Kediaman 4 (KK4)
- Law Faculty
- Kolej Kediaman 1 (KK1)
- Faculty of Engineering

You can live track LRT, MRT, and other buses using the following link:

https://myrapidbus.prasarana.com.my/kiosk?route=700&bus=

Additionally, there are shuttle buses available to help you navigate around the University of Malaya. Below are the PDF schedules and the stations each bus stops at.

 {PDF} UM Shuttle Bus Route and Schedule.pdf

patterns: Where can I buy a Touch 'n Go card?
How do I get a Touch 'n Go card?
What are the steps to obtain a Touch 'n Go card?
Can I buy a Touch 'n Go card online?
Which locations sell Touch 'n Go cards?
Is there a specific store to purchase a Touch 'n Go card?
Are Touch 'n Go cards available at convenience stores?
What documents do I need to buy a Touch 'n Go card?
How much does a Touch 'n Go card cost?
Can I get a Touch 'n Go card at the airport?
Where can I recharge my Touch 'n Go card after purchasing it?
Are there any promotions for getting a Touch 'n Go card?
Is the Touch 'n Go card available at transit stations?
Can I get a Touch 'n Go card at a kiosk?
Do I need to register to get a Touch 'n Go card?
Are Touch 'n Go cards sold at supermarkets?
Can tourists buy a Touch 'n Go card?
Is it possible to get a personalized Touch 'n Go card?
Are Touch 'n Go cards available at petrol stations?
Can I buy a Touch 'n Go card from a vending machine?
responses:
Touch 'n Go card is very useful for you to access public transport around KL. You will need Touch 'n Go card to ride the LRT, MRT, BRT, KTM, and their respective station busses. You can also use it for pay for your parking in the mall and also to buy some items from selected vending machine.

You can obtain a Touch 'n Go card from various locations. Here are the detailed steps and places where you can get one:

1. Convenience Stores and Supermarkets:

- Touch 'n Go cards are widely available at major convenience stores such as 7-Eleven, MyNews, and KK Mart.
- You can also purchase them at larger supermarkets like AEON, Tesco, and Giant.

2. Transit Stations:

- Many major transit stations, including LRT, MRT, and monorail stations, sell Touch 'n Go cards at their customer service counters.
- Some bus terminals also offer Touch 'n Go cards at their information or ticket counters.

3. Touch 'n Go Hubs and Kiosks:

- You can visit official Touch 'n Go hubs located in major shopping malls or transit hubs for purchasing a card.
- There are also self-service kiosks available at some locations where you can buy and reload your card.

4. Online Purchase:

- Touch 'n Go cards can be purchased online through the official Touch 'n Go e-commerce site or through major e-commerce platforms like Lazada and Shopee.
- Delivery options are available, and you may need to register an account for the purchase.

5. Petrol Stations:

- Selected petrol stations such as Shell, Petronas, and Caltex sell Touch 'n Go cards.

6. Airports:

- At major airports, you can find Touch 'n Go cards at convenience stores or designated counters in the arrivals area.

7. Cost and Registration:

- The price of a Touch 'n Go card is usually around RM10, and this may or may not include a preloaded balance.
- Registration is not mandatory to purchase a standard card, but it is recommended for security and additional services. You can register your card online via the Touch 'n Go portal.

8. Reloading Your Card:

- Once you have your card, you can reload it at any of the above locations, as well as through online banking, mobile apps, and ATMs.
- Look out for promotions and discounts that might be available when you purchase or reload your card.

9. Tourists and Visitors:

- Tourists can easily buy a Touch 'n Go card at the same locations as locals. It is a convenient option for travel and shopping within Malaysia.
- Personalized Touch 'n Go cards with custom designs are available, usually through online orders or special promotions.

By following these guidelines, you can easily obtain and use a Touch 'n Go card for your convenience in Malaysia. If you have any further questions, feel free to ask any customer service representative at the respective stores or contact the Touch 'n Go customer service.
